name: Agriculture Science
abstract: Farming, Fisheries, Forestry, Poultry, Animal Husbandry, and Food Production Studies
description: Agricultural Science Studies focus on basic educational knowledge of scientific principles and best agriculture practices, including traditional means of Farming, Forestry, and Fishing. The study provides basics knowledge integrating Crop Science, Animal Science, Soil Science, Agricultural Economics, Horticulture, Agricultural Engineering and Food Science.
careerRequirements: Most agricultural workers require formal education from agricultural colleges, universities, or technical schools. Entry-level positions may require JHS or SHS education, while management positions require bachelor's or advanced degrees.

name: Administration
abstract: Administration, Secretarial, and Office Support Studies
description: The Commercial Course offers learners basic educational knowledge in Administration, Secretarial and Office Support Studies, that equip students with the skills and experience required to manage administrative tasks and support organizational operations effectively.
careerRequirements: Most administrative and office support workers have degrees from universities or diplomas from higher education institutions. Some employers prefer college, vocational, or secretarial high school graduates.

name: Business & Finance
abstract: Business, Accounting, Banking, and Financial Studies
description: The Business, Accounting, Banking, and Financial Studies provide the basic educational knowledge and training of a comprehensive field that covers various aspects of commerce, finance, and economic transactions. This field is vital for understanding how businesses operate and financial systems underpin the economy.
careerRequirements: Most positions require at least a high school education. Financial professionals typically need bachelor's degrees or professional certifications (CPA, CFA). Insurance and investment roles often require specialized licensing.

name: Management
abstract: Management, Leadership, Politics, and Authority Studies
description: The Management, Leadership, Politics, and Authority Studies provide the basic educational knowledge which delve into the principles and practices of guiding organizations, influencing political systems, and exercising power and authority.
careerRequirements: Most managers have college degrees and many have advanced degrees (MBA). Entry-level supervisory positions may require high school education plus experience.

name: Technical/Vocational
abstract: Technical, Construction, Repairs, and Maintenance, Fashion and Catering Studies
description: The Technical/Vocational studies provide basic educational knowledge focusing on design, building, fitting, mechanics, and other specialized sectors such as Fashion, Clothing, and Catering Services. These fields are essential for creating and maintaining the built environment.
careerRequirements: Most workers in this field complete apprenticeships or attend technical and vocational schools. Some positions require JHS/SHS education plus on-the-job training.

name: Production Technology
abstract: Industrial Processing, Machinery, Manufacturing, and Production Studies
description: The Industrial Technology studies provide the basic educational knowledge of a broad field that encompasses various aspects of creating goods and managing industrial processes. This field is dynamic and continuously evolving with advancements in technology.
careerRequirements: Requirements vary from high school diplomas to associate or bachelor's degrees. Technical certifications and specialized training are often required.

name: Home Science
abstract: Home Economics, Personal Services, Fashion and Catering Studies
description: The Home Science studies provide the basic educational knowledge that focuses on skills and knowledge related to individual well-being, family management, and consumer services.
careerRequirements: Requirements range from on-the-job training to specialized vocational training programs and college degrees in culinary arts, fashion, or interior design.

name: Hospitality & Tourism
abstract: Hospitality, Hotelier, Travel and Tourism Studies
description: The Hospitality and Tourism studies provide the basic educational knowledge of hospitality and tourism industries, including hotels, restaurants, travel agencies, event planning and tourism management.
careerRequirements: Most positions require at least high school education. Many hotel and restaurant positions require hospitality certifications or associate degrees.

name: Audio Visual & Physical Arts
abstract: Audio Visual Arts, Performing Arts and Literary Arts, Sports, Music, and Design Studies
description: The Sports, Music and Entertainment Studies provide the basic educational knowledge of an interdisciplinary field which focuses on preparing students for careers in sports, music and entertainment industries.
careerRequirements: Many careers require natural talent and training, but degrees in fine arts, music, theater, or sports management are beneficial for advanced positions.

name: Multimedia Arts
abstract: Radio and Television, Media, Communication, and Journalism Studies
description: The Multimedia Arts studies provide basic educational knowledge covering a diverse range of disciplines focused on creative, analysis, and interpretation of audio visual and media content.
careerRequirements: Most media and journalism positions require bachelor's degrees in communication, journalism, or related fields. Portfolio development is important.

name: Law & Legal Arts
abstract: Law, Legal Systems, Human Rights and Constitutional Studies
description: The Law and Legal Systems studies provide basic educational knowledge involving the exploration of legal principles, institutions, and practices that govern societies.
careerRequirements: Most lawyers require a law degree (JD or LLB) from an accredited law school. Paralegals typically need associate or bachelor's degrees with legal training.

name: Education & Training
abstract: Education, Training, Teaching and Learning, and Faculty Studies
description: The Education studies offer basic educational knowledge of teaching, training and education studies as an academic and professional field focused on the theory and practice of facilitating learning.
careerRequirements: Almost all teachers need a bachelor's degree. Many positions require professional teacher training and certification. Advanced positions require master's or doctoral degrees.

name: Social Science
abstract: Humanities, Communities, Civil Protection and Social Studies
description: The Social Science studies provide basic educational knowledge of societal structures, the role of community engagement, and strategies for ensuring public safety and well-being.
careerRequirements: Minimum high school education required for most entry-level positions. Counselors, social workers, and psychologists require bachelor's or advanced degrees.

name: Health Science
abstract: Health Care, Medicine, and Allied Health Studies
description: The Health Science studies provide basics educational knowledge of scientific, social, and behavioral aspects of health care and wellness, focusing on prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases.
careerRequirements: Healthcare careers require specialized education. Physicians and dentists need medical/dental degrees. Nurses require BSN or ADN. Allied health professions require associate or bachelor's degrees.

name: Engineering Science
description: The Engineering Science studies provide the basic educational knowledge of a broad interdisciplinary field that integrates principles of engineering, scientific methods, and mathematical analysis to solve real-world technical problems.
careerRequirements: Most engineering positions require bachelor's degrees in engineering disciplines. Many advanced positions require master's degrees or professional engineering licenses (PE).

name: Life & Physical Science
abstract: Life, Physical, and Astronomical Science Studies
description: The Life, Physical and Astronomical Science Studies provide the basic educational knowledge of a wide range of disciplines that explore the natural world, from molecular mechanisms of life to fundamental principles governing the universe.
careerRequirements: Most scientists have at least bachelor's degrees. Advanced research positions typically require master's or PhD degrees.

name: Computer Science
abstract: Computers, Technology, IoT, Robotics and Coding Studies
description: The Computer Science studies focus on the basic educational knowledge of understanding, designing and applying modern technological systems and programming languages to solve real-world problems.
careerRequirements: Most computer science positions require bachelor's degrees in computer science or related fields. Some entry-level positions accept certifications or bootcamp graduates.

name: Transportation Science
abstract: Aviation, Shipping, Railways and Vehicular Studies
description: The Transportation studies provide basic educational knowledge in planning, design, management and optimization of transportation systems and facilities, emphasizing sustainability, efficiency and safety.
careerRequirements: Requirements vary: pilots need specialized certifications and hours, truck drivers need commercial licenses, while managers typically need bachelor's degrees in transportation or logistics.
